text: How I learned English?
Growing up in a small town in Delhi, I always had a big dreams. One of my biggest dream was to learn English.
I admired people who could speak English fluently. They seemed confident, knowledgeable, and worldly.
I wanted to be like them. But my journey to learning English was not easy. It took a lot of hard work, determination and patience.
My early days in my small town, not many people spoke English. We mostly communicated in our local language, Hindi.
My school offered English classes, but they were not very advanced. We learned basic words and sentences. But there was
a little opportunity to practice speaking.
I remember feeling frustrated because I wanted to learn more, but I didn't know how.
My inspiration came from a teacher named Mrs. Sharma. She was our English teacher in middle school. Mrs. Sharma had a
passion for English and she made her classes interesting.
She told us stories in English, played English songs and showed us English movies with subtitles.
Sharma told us about the importance of learning English. She said it could open many doors for us in the future. Whether
we wanted to travel, study abroad or get good jobs, English was essential. her words stayed with me and I decided that I would do whatever it took to
learn English.
I made a habit of learning five new English words every day. I would write them down in a notebook along with their meanings and example sentences.
Then I would try to use those words in my conversations. At first it was challenging. I often forgot the words or
use them incorrectly. But I didn't give up. Slowly my vocabulary started to improve.
Reading books one of the most effective ways I found to learn English.
I loved reading stories about different places and cultures. Reading not only improved my vocabulary but also helped
me understand sentence structures and grammar.
Another fun way I learned English was by watching movies and listening to stories.
One of the biggest challenges I faced was practicing speaking. I was shy and afraid of making mistakes. But I knew
that speaking was essential if I wanted to be fluent.
So I started practicing in front of mirror. I would talk to myself in English, pretending to have conversations. This helped me become
more comfortable with speaking.
Learning a new language is not easy. And there were moments when I wanted to give up. But I reminded myself of my dream
and the reason why I wanted to learn English.
I also had the support of my family and friends. They encouraged me and celebrated my progress. no matter how small.
One of the biggest challenges I faced was the fear of making mistakes. I was afraid that people would laugh at me or
think I was not smart. But I realized that making mistakes is a part of learning.
Mistake was a lesson and it helped me improve. I learned to laugh at mistakes and keep trying.
I finally achieved my dream of speaking English fluently.
I could have conversation with native speakers, read books without a dictionary and understand English stories without subtitles.
It was a proud moment for me and it opened many doors. I got a scholarship to study abroad and I was able to travel
and meet people from different cultures.
English had truly become a part of my life.
Even though I had achieved my goal, I knew that learning a language is a lifelong journey. There is always something new to learn. I continue to
read, watch movies, and take courses to improve my English.
I also help others who were learning English, sharing my experiences and tips.
As I became more confident in my English skills, I started helping others who were learning the language. I volunteered to teach English at a local
community center.
It was a rewarding experience and it helped me reinforce my own knowledge.
Teaching others made me realize how much I had learned and how far I had come.
Learning English had a significant impact on my life. It opened up many opportunities that I wouldn't have had otherwise. I was able to apply for
scholarships and study abroad.
Conclusion: Learning English was one of the best decision I ever made. It was not an easy journey, but it was worth
it. It taught me the value of hard work, perseverance, and determination.
It also opened up a world of opportunities and allowed me to achieve my dreams.
If I could give one piece of advice to anyone learning a new language, it would be to never give up. With patience and
dedication, anything is possible.
I hope my story inspires you to pursue your dreams, no matter how challenging they may seem. Learning English has
enriched my life in many ways and I am confident it can do the same for you.
Remember, every small step you take brings you closer to your goal. Keep learning and keep practicing.
